meanings.definition: To deceive or outsmart someone by using cunning or trickery.
meanings.sent1: She outtricked her friend in the game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent2: The sly fox outtricked the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The clever raccoon outtricked the curious cat by leading it on a wild chase.
meanings.sent4: The magician outtricked the audience with his mind-bending illusions.
meanings.sent5: The detective outtricked the criminal by setting up a clever trap.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in trickery or deceit.
meanings.sent1: He outtricked his opponent in the chess match by using a surprising move.
meanings.sent2: The con artist outtricked the unsuspecting victims with his elaborate scheme.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey outtricked the zookeeper by stealing the keys to the banana cage.
meanings.sent4: The master thief outtricked the security system and made off with the priceless jewels.
meanings.sent5: The cunning spy outtricked the enemy agents and retrieved the top-secret documents.
